findings.liver: diffusely hypoattenuating, suggestive of hepatic steatosis, with ill-defined geographic hyperattenuating areas
findings.pancreas: normal attenuation throughout, without evidence of focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilatation
findings.spleen: normal size and attenuation, incidental 1.1 cm splenule noted
findings.kidneys: normal and symmetric size with normal nephrogram, no focal renal lesions or hydronephrosis
findings.gastrointestinal: mild hiatal hernia, stomach unremarkable, small bowel loops normal, diverticulum in the second part of the duodenum noted
findings.appendix: fluid-filled, distended to 1.6 cm, bowel wall thickening and hyperemia, extensive surrounding fat stranding
findings.lymph nodes: mildly prominent mesenteric lymph nodes in the right lower quadrant, likely reactive
findings.vascular: no abdominal aortic aneurysm, mild atherosclerotic disease
findings.bones: no evidence of worrisome lesions or acute fractures, mild degenerative changes of the thoracolumbar spine
